intro: Oreocarya depressa, commonly known as the low oreocarya, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with dense clusters of small, evergreen leaves. It produces bell-shaped, pink or white flowers in the spring, which are clustered in inflorescences. Oreocarya depressa typically thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to harsh, alpine environments.
